sentences.english: They said they would disturb the gods that dwelt in the upper air.
sentences.chinese: 他們說飛機會攪擾住在高空的神靈。

sentences.english: His wishful face haunts my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 他的熱切的臉，如夜雨似的，攪擾着我的夢魂。

sentences.english: Having an interior storm of doubting thoughts, Peter was sinking.
sentences.chinese: 受到內心懷疑的風暴攪擾，伯多祿險遭傾覆。

sentences.english: Him wishful face haunts my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 他的熱切的臉，如夜雨似的，攪擾着我的夢魂。

sentences.english: Her wishful face haunts my dreams like the rain at night .
sentences.chinese: 熱切的臉，如夜雨似的，攪擾着我的夢魂。

sentences.english: Your wishful face haunts my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 你熱切的臉，如夜雨似的，攪擾着我的夢魂。

sentences.english: Her wishful face haunt my dream like the rai at ight.
sentences.chinese: 她的熱切的臉，如夜雨似的，攪擾着我的夢魂。

sentences.english: I was bothered by a pilferer named hacker.
Men are hmothered by the vastness of eternity.
sentences.chinese: 人類總是受永久之宏壯的攪擾。

sentences.english: Her wishful face haunts my dreams like the rain at night。
sentences.chinese: 她的熱切的臉，如夜雨似的，攪擾着我的夢魂。

sentences.english: This is one of the easiest way to really annoy your web site visitors.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個很簡單的方法來攪擾你真的網站訪客。

sentences.english: He danced, howled, raved, and otherwise disturbed the welkin .
sentences.chinese: 他又跳，又吼，又叫，使盡各種伎倆來攪擾這蒼穹。

definition: to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to hear but not react (idiom); to turn a deaf ear/to ignore deliberately
lit. to turn to any doctor one can find when critically ill (idiom); fig. to try anyone or anything in a crisis
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
